alert.note: Alert for Fall River (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 2:28PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fall River County through 300 PM MDT... At 228 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Oelrichs, or 21 miles southeast of Hot Springs, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oelrichs and Hay Canyon Butte. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
